article:
Sixth-grade schoolteacher Ms.Shelton believed in readiness.Students remembered how she walked in on the first day of class and began writing words of eighth-grade on the  _  .They quickly protested that the words were not on their  _  and they couldn't learn them.
Their teacher insisted that the students could and would learn these  _  .She said that she would teach them something that should be given.Ms.Shelton  _  by saying that one of the students in the classroom could go on to  _  , maybe even be president someday, and she wanted to prepare them for that day.
Ms.Shelton spoke those words many years ago.  _  did she know that someday one of her students--Jesse Jackson--would take them  _  .She believed that if they were well prepared, they could  _  high goals.
Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, "People only see what they are  _  to see." If that's true, then it is also  _  that they only become what they are prepared to become.And many things in life are just about getting ready.
"I want to be doing something more  _  with my life than what I am doing now," a young man once said to me.He  _  what he was doing was just not that important.Other people have said things to me such as, "I only  _  I had a meaningful relationship." And, "I'd really like to get a better job, but I just don't see  _  ."
You fill in the blanks.What is it you would like to  _  that isn't happening? Perhaps the answer is that you are not yet  _  .Maybe you need more time to prepare before you are truly ready for the things which you  _  .
Think of today as another chance to  _  yourself for the exciting future you are looking for.Today is not wasted.If you desire more from  _  , then you can use today as training.For you will experience only what you are prepared to  _  .Something wonderful can happen.And you can use today to get ready for tomorrow.
